alert.note: Alert for Adams; Morgan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 10 at 5:02PM MDT until May 10 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Morgan County in northeastern Colorado... Central Adams County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 545 PM MDT. * At 501 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles west of Leader, or 33 miles southwest of Fort Morgan, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * Locations impacted include... Hoyt. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado.
